overview.overviewDescription:
The Business Continuity Management 101 course provides a comprehensive and structured introduction to the principles, concepts, and practices of Business Continuity Management. Designed for professionals seeking to build awareness and establish foundational competencies, this course explores how organizations can prepare for, respond to, and recover from disruptive incidents with confidence. Participants will gain a solid understanding of the requirements of ISO 22301 and learn how it provides a framework for maintaining the continuity of critical operations and protecting vital assets
Through this program, learners will be introduced to the Business Continuity Lifecycle (Plan–Do–Check–Act), a systematic approach that ensures continuity strategies are not only planned but also implemented, tested, and continually improved. The course covers introduction to key components such as Incident Response Structure, Business Impact Analysis (BIA), Risk Assessment (RA), Strategy and Solutions, BCM Documentation, BCM Testing and many more, giving learners a holistic view of how continuity is developed, implemented, and maintained.
By the end of the course, learners will be equipped with the knowledge and insights needed to support resilience initiatives needed to safeguard your organization against potential disruptions.

keyHighlights: The course comprises 3 modules with 10 lesson areas.
Build a strong foundation in Business Continuity Management (BCM) concepts and fundamentals.
Gain practical understanding of ISO 22301 Business Continuity Management System (BCMS) requirements.
Gain hands-on knowledge of BIA, Risk Assessment, and Continuity Strategies.
Learn how to create and manage BCM documentation, plans, and recovery procedures.
Appreciate the importance of testing, exercises, and continual improvement in strengthening resilience.
Understand how to evaluate BCMS performance through audits, reviews, and corrective actions.

dynamicContent.title: Why Join This Course?
list: Gain a solid foundation in the basic fundamentals and concepts of Business Continuity Management.
Understand the requirements of ISO 22301 Business Continuity Management System (BCMS).
Understand the key stages of the Business Continuity Lifecycle.
Learn how risks and impacts on critical operations are identified and addressed.
Build awareness of effective continuity strategies and response arrangements.
Strengthen organizational readiness by appreciating the role of testing and continual improvement.

attendees: Professionals new to Business Continuity or Risk Management
Business Continuity and Risk Management Specialists.
Leaders, managers and supervisors responsible for business, operations or compliance.
IT, HR, Finance, Health &Safety, and Security staff supporting continuity and recovery efforts.
ISO 22301 Internal auditors.
Anyone seeking foundational knowledge of ISO 22301 and BCM practices.

overview.overviewDescription: Sustainability Reporting Fundamentals provides a comprehensive introduction to the evolving world of sustainability reporting. Beginning with corporate sustainability fundamentals, the course explores the rising demand for sustainability disclosures, the principles guiding effective reporting, and the practical steps organizations can take to produce meaningful reports. Learners will also examine the unique challenges in reporting, such as catering to multiple audiences, standardizing data, and ensuring credibility. By the end of the course, participants will understand how sustainability reporting supports transparency, compliance, risk management, and long-term business success, while also positioning organizations to meet investor, regulatory, and societal expectations

keyHighlights: Step-by-step introduction to sustainability reporting concepts and evolution
Exploration of global and local reporting ecosystems and trends
Practical guidance on applying reporting principles and approaches
Insights on reporting formats and the role of technology
Discussion of real-world challenges and future opportunities in reporting
Aligned with global frameworks (GRI, SASB, TCFD, IFRS)

list: Gain a clear foundation in one of today’s most in-demand business skills
Understand regulatory and market drivers shaping corporate disclosures
Build practical skills to support sustainability report preparation
Learn how to communicate sustainability performance credibly and effectively

overview.overviewDescription:
This course introduces the fundamentals of Occupational Health and Safety (OHS), focusing on workplace laws, standards, and programs that ensure a safe and healthy environment. It equips learners with the skills to identify hazards, conduct risk assessments, and implement effective safety measures. The course also covers emergency preparedness and response, employees’ compensation protocols, and the roles of OSH personnel. Finally, it develops trainers’ capacity to communicate OHS concepts, deliver mandatory safety seminars, and foster a culture of safety through continuous training and engagement.

Basic Occupational Health and Safety 1 offers a practical guide to building a safe and healthy workplace in line with Philippine laws and standards. Beginning with the foundations of OSH principles and mandatory programs, the course explores accident causation, unsafe acts and conditions, hazard identification, and risk assessment through HIRAC techniques. Learners will gain clarity on safety programs covering housekeeping, fire, machine, electrical, and chemical safety, as well as emergency preparedness, response protocols, and the Employees’ Compensation Program. By the end, participants will be ready to apply OSH principles, conduct risk assessments, implement safety measures, and contribute to a culture of compliance and worker protection.

keyHighlights: Clear introduction to OSH principles, Philippine laws, and global context.
Step-by-step guidance on hazard identification, risk assessment (HIRAC), and control measures.
Practical walkthrough of essential safety programs, including housekeeping, fire, machine, electrical, and chemical safety.
Exploration of workplace emergency preparedness, employee compensation protocols, and the role of OSH trainers in fostering a culture of safety.

dynamicContent.title: Learning Objectives
list: Understand the foundations, principles, and legal framework of Occupational Health and Safety.
Learn the requirements of mandatory OSH programs and compliance with Philippine standards.
Gain practical skills to identify workplace hazards and conduct risk assessments using HIRAC.
Apply essential safety measures across material handling, machines, electricity, fire, and chemical management.
Enhance workplace safety, emergency preparedness, and employee well-being through effective OSH practices.

Supervisors, managers, and team leaders
Safety officers and OSH committee members
Human resource and compliance officers
Contractors, subcontractors, and site personnel in high-risk activities
Trainers, educators, and practitioners pursuing careers in occupational safety and health

overview.overviewDescription:
This course introduces learners to the IFRS Sustainability Disclosure Standards—S1 (General Requirements) and S2 (Climate-related Disclosures). It provides the context, purpose, and practical application of these standards, equipping participants with the knowledge to align sustainability disclosures with global best practices and investor expectations.

IFRS S1 and S2 Fundamentals explores the global drivers of sustainability reporting, the role of the IFRS Foundation and ISSB, and how these standards establish a global baseline for disclosure. The course unpacks the core requirements of IFRS S1, the climate-specific disclosures of IFRS S2, and guides learners in transitioning from compliance to meaningful action. By the end of the course, participants will understand how IFRS S1 and S2 help organizations manage risks, build credibility, and integrate sustainability into financial reporting.

keyHighlights: Clear introduction to IFRS S1 and S2, their scope, and purpose
Practical breakdown of core disclosure pillars (Governance, Strategy, Risk Management, Metrics & Targets)
Mapping S2 requirements to TCFD and SASB frameworks
Insights into jurisdictional adoption, compliance pathways, and alignment with GRI and ESRS
Guidance on conducting gap assessments and developing transition plans

dynamicContent.title: Learning Objectives
list: Understand the global context behind IFRS sustainability standards and the ISSB’s role
Gain knowledge of IFRS S1 requirements and how they support comprehensive disclosures
Apply IFRS S2 climate-specific disclosures, including metrics, targets, and scenario analysis
Conduct a high-level gap assessment and propose steps to align organizational reporting with IFRS S1 and S2

attendees: Sustainability, Finance, and Compliance professionals preparing for IFRS adoption
Investor relations and corporate communications teams
Business leaders and managers responsible for ESG strategy and disclosures
Auditors and assurance providers supporting sustainability reporting
Educators, students, and professionals seeking expertise in IFRS-based reporting
